intro: Satureja rhombifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a strong, pungent aroma. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in summer. Satureja rhombifolia is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a culinary herb due to its distinctive flavor.
